instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00928-A not turning on
threads.message:
Good morning, I have a Mac that won't turn on, no oxidation.

I have taken the following measurements:


PPBUS_G3H: 12.65V
PP3V3_S0: 3.4V
ALL_SYS_PWRGD: 0V ~ 2.8V PULSE
PP3V3_S5: 3.3V
PLT_RST_L: 0V

threads.title: 820-00928-A not turning on
threads.message:
If 3V3_S0 is stable, ALL_SYS_PWRGD should be stable too.
Post voltage for other S3 and S0 voltages, including CPU coils.

threads.title: 820-00928-A not turning on
threads.message:
PP1V2_S3 = 0v, pulsing 1.12V
PP1V2_S0SW = 0V, pulsing 1.003V
PP1V0_SUS = 1.005V
PP1V8_S3 = 0V, pulsing 1.73V
PP1V8_S0SW = 0V, pulsing 1.8V
PP3V3_SUS 3.32V

L7410 / 7420 - 0V
L7221 / 7211/7231 - 0V
L7330 - 0V, pulsing 0.8V
LA350 - 0V
LA300 - 0V
L7420 - 0V

threads.title: 820-00928-A not turning on
threads.message:
Are you sure 3V3_S0 is not pulsing?
What about PM_SLP_S3_L then?

threads.title: 820-00928-A not turning on
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 71838, member: 682"]
Are you sure 3V3_S0 is not pulsing?
[/QUOTE]Sorry, it is pulsing 0V ~ 3.034V.
PM_SLP_S3_L 0V ~2.923V pulsing.

threads.title: 820-00928-A not turning on
threads.message:
No pulse at all at L7211/21/31?
3V3_S5/SUS both steady?

threads.title: 820-00928-A not turning on
threads.message:
pulses:
L7231 100mV
L7221 8mV 
L7211 30mV


steady:
PP3V3_S5 3.32V 
PP3V3_SUS 3.32V

threads.title: 820-00928-A not turning on
threads.message:
Looks like no pulse at all at VCORE.
When you have doubts, an o-scope can help you; it catches the peak of any fast pulse.

Did you try SMC bypass mode?

threads.title: 820-00928-A not turning on
threads.message:
using o-scope:
L7410 40mV
L7420 40mV
L7211 40mV
L7221 40mV
L7231 40mV
L7330 1.08V
LA650 40mV
LA350 40mV
It does not go into SMC bypass mode.

threads.title: 820-00928-A not turning on
threads.message:
I tested another BIOS with the same voltages, with no result. 
Here is the link BIOS dump I used.

[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1k1MRz1mZSnCzn-L54XCNB8hlTXxXsek6/view?usp=sharing[/URL]

threads.title: 820-00928-A not turning on
threads.message:
Possibly bad CPU.

Did you test the board alone on the desk?
Always pulsing?

threads.title: 820-00928-A not turning on
threads.message:
PVCCCORE_PH1_VCC oscillates between 0.354V ~ 4.661V . 
I thought it might be U7210 and U7420, so I replaced them, but no result.

 I tested it always off the table.

PP1V8_AWAKE_SW3C 0 ~ 0.881V 
PMU_TO_SOC_AWAKE_PWRGD 0.170 ~ 0.827 V
PP3V0_AWAKE_LDO7 0V ~ 1.435V

threads.title: 820-00928-A not turning on
threads.message: Done T2 restore, it worked, thanks!

threads.title: 820-00928-A not turning on
threads.message:
PVCCCORE_PH1_VCC oscila entre 0,354V ~ 4,661V.
Achei que fossem U7210 e U7420, então os substituí, mas nenhum resultado.

Testei sempre fora da mesa.

PP1V8_AWAKE_SW3C 0 ~ 0,881V
PMU_TO_SOC_AWAKE_PWRGD 0,170 ~ 0,827 V
PP3V0_AWAKE_LDO7 0V ~ 1,435V

threads.title: 820-00928-A not turning on
threads.message:
Post in english please.
I didn't understand previous post...
